Posts.Content: chicagomom wrote: I had saline implants put in at the same time I had my double mastectomy and have been wearing sports bras only since as my surgeon said I need good support.  I want my boobs to end up looking as natural and like my old ones as possible and am sick of the sports bras and want something cute and more of a normal bra but with great side support.  I am so sick of these sports bras and have a wedding in few weeks and don't want to be wearing one under a dress.  Anyone have ideas?  Thanks!! Dx 9/10/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 2/15 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: bra help chicagomom TXBadboob

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2009 06:55PM chicagomom wrote: Shel- do you happen to live on the East Coast?  I am in Chicago and seems the protocol is TCH - East Coast - AC-T with herceptin.  I was offered the AC-T plus herceptin with a clinical trial of Lapatinib today.  I don't know what to do...is that the trial you were offered, too?
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2009 09:53AM - edited Nov 5, 2009 09:54AM by chicagomom Thanks Brenda.  I am having 6 (now 5) treatments of TCH every 3 weeks for then maybe radiation for 6 weeks....Herceptin for a full year to two.  Took an Ambein CR last night and still was wide awake - tired today but not working so now that the kids are in school, I can nap.  I too cut my long hair shorter and will go shorter in the next week or two.  Take care ladies!!
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2009 03:54PM chicagomom wrote: BRENDA-my hair was less than 10 in and now cut it is short....I also ordered a wig.  My little sis is prego with her second baby and I swear we have the same symptoms.  The day she found out she was pregnant was the day I found out I had cancer.  Her baby has the same due date as my daughter --- odd.  She e-mailed me today about wanting cheese fries and I have not been able to get them off my mind --- so far day #2 is like being pregnant!! Stay strong ladies!!
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2009 07:49AM chicagomom wrote: anamary 1 -thrilled this is not having a bad effect on you!!! as for my fellow TCH sisters, I am with you - feel like HELL!  Adavin (sp?) helps as does resting but it is not easy.  I cannot imagine working thru this!!!  I am on disability and when I do feel okay I want my kids and family to see that.  I had my second tx on the 25th - got thru Thanksgiving okay and supposed to go to a wedding tonight - we'll see...I do have a beautiful wig and cute new boobs I would like to show of... I second using baby wipes!!  I have daily diarrhea (so gross but it is what it is).  We can and will get thru this ladies - I am sure of it!!! Take care all and remember this is not the time to play hero!!  When you need help - ask for it.
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2009 08:20PM chicagomom wrote: Hi ladies- I too just had my first TCH today.  It went well.  Very thirsty/peeing a lot and eating watermelon.  Can't really complain yet....Brenda-can you include me on these updates? Thanks
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 07:27PM chicagomom wrote: Kimmy-I am 35 with a 6 yr old daughter and a 4 yr old son. Bottkota-sorry you find yourself here again...praying for you!! 3rd day post treatment and hungry and cranky as Hell!  I am in a bad mood and have really itchy palms  - mild nasea and fatigue but okay.  Oh and emotional - just pissy that I have to endure this - I know we all do but still just in a foul mood.  Weather is sunny and warm for Chicago so I should be happy - trying to focus on the positive.... Good night ladies and hope you are all as well as you can be!!
Posts.Title: November 2009-Starting Chemo BrendaSharon livelife

Posts.Content: chicagomom wrote: I had my second round of TCH on Nov 25th.  My next one is Dec 16th.  I have a 4 yr old and a 6 yr old and have been sick almost the whole time.  Really sick now and on antibiotics. Do I assume I will be this sick for the rest of my treatment??  It is really hard....anything I can do aside from living in a bubble!?!?!? Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2009 07:52AM chicagomom wrote: Thanks ladies- Yazmin - I live in Chicago so I should be able to find a doc similar to yours.  Once I have my voice back I will call around.  All in all, aside from the constant colds, I have tolerated the chemo rather well.   Take care-
Posts.Title: help-chemo is killin my immune system chicagomom LRM216

Posts.Content: chicagomom wrote: Hi- I had my nipple/skin sparing mastectomy in Oct of 2009.  In March of 2011 I started having nipple pain in the right (non-cancer) side.  My oncologist told me to see my breast surgeon so I did and he said the pain is due to sensation coming back.  Here we are at the end of June and it feels worse...throbbing pain - anyone who had a nipple/skin sparing mastectomy ever experience this??  Can sensation coming back hurt like this?  Should I push for a mammo?? Thanks Dx 9/10/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 2/15 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: nipple pain post skin/nipple sparing mastectomy chicagomom mamabooth

Posts.Content: chicagomom wrote: Hi all - I finished 3 of 6 chemo (TCH) treatments.  My olcoogist referred me to a rads oncologist I see on Jan 7th.  Typically, when do you need rads?  My tumor is just under 1 cm, had a double mast, er, pr- and HER2+  and 2 pos nodes - thoughts?  Just trying to mentally prep myself for what may be coming...
